summary: Backend change clearly enforces a hardcoded admin password in deleteChatroomWithPassword, and the frontend admin delete page includes a sessionStorage-based password gate. However, the diff summary does not provide evidence that getChatrooms() was modified to stop stripping data: URLs, nor that all non-admin backend operations now bypass AccessControl authorization checks.

missing_requirements.requirement: Modify ONLY backend/main.mo inside public query func getChatrooms() so it no longer replaces chatroom.mediaUrl with null when it contains "data:", returning the stored mediaUrl unchanged.
missing_requirements.reason: The provided backend/main.mo diff excerpt is truncated before any getChatrooms() implementation is shown, so there is no evidence that the data:-URL stripping logic was removed within getChatrooms() (or that the change was limited only to that function body).

missing_requirements.requirement: Update backend/main.mo so all non-admin operations succeed regardless of AccessControl/caller authorization checks by removing or bypassing AccessControl.hasPermission/isAdmin or related blocking logic.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff excerpt shows AccessControl state initialization and several AccessControl-exposing methods still present, but does not show any removal/bypass of authorization checks across non-admin operations (e.g., create chatroom, send message, profile ops, reactions). With truncation, there is insufficient evidence that these checks were neutralized.
evidence: backend/main.mo (truncated; only AccessControl init and role/admin query/assign functions shown, plus partial deleteChatroomWithPassword)
